intro: Senecio loratifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are broad and often hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
